forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 5 to 9 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. North wind 2 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle embrace of mostly cloudy skies wraps the city. The current temperature lingers in the cool mid-forties, accompanied by a whisper of a northwest wind drifting at modest speeds. The low light plays tricks on the eye, hinting at a possible marine layer lingering around the horizons that smudges the line where the city meets the bay, yet there remains a clarity to the urban landscape that invites evening wanderings.

Moving into the daylight hours of Monday, expect the sun to break through the cloud cover, offering glimpses of brightness that will warm the air to a comfortable sixty-three. By afternoon, a light touch of chill will descend as temperatures gently recede. The north winds, with their occasional gusts, promise a refreshing rustle, perhaps nudging you to dress lightly layered, ready for moments of both sunshine and a quick retreat into that famous coolness. The conditions are ideal for a leisurely stroll through local parks or perhaps a quiet afternoon in a coffee shop, admiring the commotion of city life while savoring a warm cup of your favorite brew—each small pleasure harmonizing with the rhythm of San Francisco’s ever-evolving scenery.
